{{Relevant guide|Java Edition guides/Spring to Life|Bedrock Edition guides/Spring to Life}}
'''Spring to Life''' is a [[game drop]] that released on March 25, 2025, as [[Java Edition 1.21.5]] and [[Bedrock Edition 1.21.70]].<ref name=releasedate /> It focuses on nature related features such as warm and cold variants to various passive farm animals, new foliage blocks to biomes, and ambience features such as sounds and falling leaf particles.

During development, the update was referred to as '''Spring Drop 2025''' and '''Drop 1 2025''' as the name of the {{BE}} [[experiment]]. The final name and release date of the update were revealed during [[Minecraft LIVE ‚Äì March 2025]], on March 22, 2025.

== Additions ==
=== Blocks ===
'''[[File:Bush JE1.png|32px]] [[Bush]]'''
* Generates in the following biomes:
** {{BiomeLink|Plains}}
** {{BiomeLink|Windswept Hills}}
** {{BiomeLink|Windswept Gravelly Hills}}
** {{BiomeLink|Windswept Forest}}
** {{BiomeLink|River}}
** {{BiomeLink|Frozen River}}
** {{BiomeLink|Forest}}
** {{BiomeLink|Birch Forest}}
** {{BiomeLink|Old Growth Birch Forest}}

'''[[File:Cactus Flower JE1.png|32px]] [[Cactus flower]]'''
* A new type of flower which can grow on [[cacti]].
* Can only be placed on full blocks.
* Can be crafted into [[pink dye]].

'''[[File:Short Dry Grass.png|32px]] [[File:Tall Dry Grass.png|32px]] [[Short Dry Grass|Short]] and [[tall dry grass]]''' 
* Generates in the [[desert]] and all types of [[badlands]].
* Can be used as fuel, smelting 0.5 items per dry grass.

'''[[File:Firefly Bush.png|32px]] [[Firefly bush]]'''
* Generates in [[swamp]]s and near [[river]]s.
* When it's light level 13 or lower, [[File:Firefly.png]] glowing firefly particles appear around the firefly bush, up to 5 blocks away.
* Make buzzing sounds at night.

'''{{animate|Leaf Litter 1 (N) JE1 BE1.png;Leaf Litter 2 (N) JE1 BE1.png;Leaf Litter 3 (N) JE1 BE1.png;Leaf Litter 4 (N) JE1 BE1.png|32px}} [[Leaf litter]]'''
* A new type of decorative block which can be found in the [[forest]]s, [[dark forest]]s and [[wooded badlands]].
* Four can be placed in one block.
* Can be used as [[fuel]], smelting 0.5 items per leaf litter.
* Can be smelted from any type of [[leaf]] block.

'''{{animate|Wildflowers 1.png;Wildflowers 2.png;Wildflowers 3.png;Wildflowers.png|32px}} [[Wildflowers]]'''
* A new type of [[flower]] which grow in [[birch forest]]s, [[old growth birch forest]]s and [[meadow]]s.
* Four can be placed in one block.
* Can be crafted into [[yellow dye]].

=== Items ===
'''{{InvSprite|Blue Egg}} [[Blue egg]]'''
* A variant of the [[egg]] laid by the cold chicken variant.
* Can spawn the cold chicken variant when hatched.

'''{{InvSprite|Brown Egg}} [[Brown egg]]'''
* A variant of the [[egg]] laid by the warm chicken variant.
* Can spawn the warm chicken variant when hatched.

'''{{InvSprite|Village Map}} New [[Explorer map]]s'''
* Sold by [[cartographer]]s.
*Village Map
** Used to find [[village]]s.
*Jungle Explorer Map
** Used to find [[jungle pyramid]]s.
*Swamp Explorer Map
** Used to find [[swamp hut]]s.

=== Mobs ===

The cold variant of each mob spawns in the following cold biomes:
* {{BiomeLink|Old Growth Pine Taiga}}
* {{BiomeLink|Old Growth Spruce Taiga}}
* {{BiomeLink|Taiga}}
* {{BiomeLink|Snowy Taiga}}
* {{BiomeLink|Windswept Hills}}
* {{BiomeLink|Windswept Gravelly Hills}}
* {{BiomeLink|Windswept Forest}}
* {{BiomeLink|Snowy Plains}}
* {{BiomeLink|Ice Spikes}}
* {{BiomeLink|Frozen Peaks}}
* {{BiomeLink|Jagged Peaks}}
* {{BiomeLink|Snowy Slopes}}
* {{BiomeLink|Grove}}
* {{BiomeLink|Stony Peaks}}
* {{BiomeLink|Frozen River}}
* {{BiomeLink|Cold Ocean}}
* {{BiomeLink|Deep Cold Ocean}}
* {{BiomeLink|Frozen Ocean}}
* {{BiomeLink|Deep Frozen Ocean}}
* {{BiomeLink|Deep Dark}}
* {{BiomeLink|The End}}
* {{BiomeLink|End Barrens}}{{only|je|short=1}}
* {{BiomeLink|Small End Islands}}{{only|je|short=1}}
* {{BiomeLink|End Midlands}}{{only|je|short=1}}
* {{BiomeLink|End Highlands}}{{only|je|short=1}}
</ref> and warm<ref group="info" name="warm biomes">
The warm variant of each mob spawns in the following warm biomes:
* {{BiomeLink|Savanna}}
* {{BiomeLink|Savanna Plateau}}
* {{BiomeLink|Windswept Savanna}}
* {{BiomeLink|Jungle}}
* {{BiomeLink|Sparse Jungle}}
* {{BiomeLink|Bamboo Jungle}}
* {{BiomeLink|Badlands}}
* {{BiomeLink|Eroded Badlands}}
* {{BiomeLink|Wooded Badlands}}
* {{BiomeLink|Desert}}
* {{BiomeLink|Mangrove Swamp}}
* {{BiomeLink|Warm Ocean}}
* {{BiomeLink|Lukewarm Ocean}}
* {{BiomeLink|Deep Lukewarm Ocean}}
* {{BiomeLink|Nether Wastes}}
* {{BiomeLink|Crimson Forest}}
* {{BiomeLink|Warped Forest}}
* {{BiomeLink|Soul Sand Valley}}
* {{BiomeLink|Basalt Deltas}}
</ref> variants of pigs, cows, and chickens.
* The variant of naturally spawned mobs is determined by the biome they spawn in.
* When [[Breeding|bred]] by a [[player]], a baby of these mobs will not be a variant chosen by the current biome, but instead randomly be selected from one of its parent's variants.
* The temperate versions of the mobs spawn by default wherever the cold and warm variants do not.

'''{{Animate|Warm Pig JE1 BE1.png;Cold Pig JE1 BE1.png|32x32px}} [[Pig]]'''
* {{EntityLink|Pig|Temperate Pig}}: The pre-existing pig variant.
* {{EntityLink|Cold Pig}}: A variant that spawns in cold biomes.<ref group="info" name="cold biomes"/>
* {{EntityLink|Warm Pig}}: A variant that spawns in warm biomes.<ref group="info" name="warm biomes"/>

'''{{Animate|Warm Cow.png;Cold Cow.png|32x32px}} [[Cow]]'''
* {{EntityLink|Cow|Temperate Cow}}: The pre-existing cow variant.
** [[File:Cow JE7 BE4.png|32px]] New texture and model.
* {{EntityLink|Cold Cow}}: A variant that spawns in certain cold biomes.<ref group="info" name="cold biomes"/>
* {{EntityLink|Warm Cow}}: A variant that spawns in certain warm biomes.<ref group="info" name="warm biomes"/>

'''{{Animate|Warm Chicken.png;Cold Chicken.png|32x32px}}  [[Chicken]]'''
* {{EntityLink|Chicken|Temperate Chicken}}: The pre-existing chicken variant.
* {{EntityLink|Cold Chicken}}: A variant that spawns in certain cold biomes.<ref group="info" name="cold biomes"/>
* {{EntityLink|Warm Chicken}}: A variant that spawns in certain warm biomes.<ref group="info" name="warm biomes"/>

=== World generation ===
'''[[File:Oak Fallen Log.png|50px]] [[Fallen tree]]'''
* Added fallen trees to {{JE}}, a new decorative variant of trees.
* Fallen trees come in four different wood type variants:
** [[Oak]]
** [[Spruce]]
** [[Birch]]
** [[Jungle tree|Jungle]]
* Birch fallen trees can come in a shorter version or a longer version.
* Fallen trees are sometimes decorated with [[mushroom]] or [[vines]].
* Fallen trees can be found in all biomes where their standing tree variants grow, except the following:
** [[Meadow]]
** [[Bamboo Jungle]]
** [[River]]
** [[Grove]]
** [[Flower Forest]]
*** Has fallen birch trees but not fallen oak trees.

== Changes ==
=== Blocks ===
'''[[File:Dormant Creaking Heart JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Creaking heart]]
* Now has a unique dormant texture.

'''[[File:Dead Bush JE6 BE4.png|32px]] [[Dead bush]]'''
* Can now make ambient sounds when placed on top of two blocks of [[sand]], [[red sand]] or any color of [[terracotta]].

'''[[File:Lodestone_JE1_BE1.png|32px]] [[Lodestone]]'''
* Can now be found in [[ruined portal]]s.
* The crafting recipe was altered to now require an [[iron ingot]] instead of a [[netherite ingot]].

* [[File:Green Leaf 3.png|16px|class=pixel-image]] All leaf blocks now have a chance of spawning falling leaf particles.

'''{{animate|Sand JE5 BE3.png;Red_Sand JE3 BE2.png;Terracotta JE2 BE2.png;White Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Light Gray Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Gray Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Black Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Brown Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Red Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Orange Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Yellow Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Lime Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Green Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Cyan Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Light Blue Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Blue Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Purple Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Magenta Terracotta JE1 BE1.png;Pink Terracotta JE1 BE1.png|32px}} [[Sand]], [[red sand]], [[terracotta]] and [[stained terracotta]]'''
* Sand, red sand and terracotta of any color have a chance of playing ambient sounds when surrounded by any one of them on at least 3 sides 8 blocks away.

=== Mobs ===
'''[[File:Plains Cartographer.png|32px]] [[Cartographer]]'''
* Cartographers now offer the following items:
* Sell 7 new [[explorer map]]s pointing to each [[village]] type as well as [[jungle temple]]s and [[witch hut]]s.
** Different biome cartographers will have different selections of these maps, available at Apprentice level.
* Cartographers from different village types sell a different range of maps and colored banners.
* Prices and quantities for some trades have been adjusted.
* [[Trial chamber]] and ocean monument maps remain available at Journeyman level.
* Colored [[banner]]s are sold at Expert level, with the range varying by biome.
* A [[woodland mansion]] map is guaranteed at Master level, along with the [[globe banner pattern]].

'''[[File:Camel Idle.gif|50px]] [[Camel]]'''
* Now spawns everywhere in [[desert]]s, not just in desert [[village]]s.

'''{{animate|Red Mooshroom JE5 BE3.png;Brown Mooshroom JE3 BE2.png|32px}} [[Mooshroom]]'''
* Changed texture and extended snout by one pixel.

'''[[File:White Sheep JE4 BE7.png|32px]] [[Sheep]]'''
* Changed the rules for sheep coloring to be based on which biome they spawn in:
** Temperate biomes (all non-warm, non-cold biomes):
*** Common: {{EntitySprite|White sheep}} White
*** Uncommon: {{EntitySprite|Black sheep}}{{EntitySprite|Gray sheep}}{{EntitySprite|Light gray sheep}}{{EntitySprite|Brown sheep}} Black, Gray, Light Gray, and Brown
*** Rare: {{EntitySprite|Pink sheep}} Pink
** Cold biomes:<ref group="info" name="cold biomes"/>
*** Common: {{EntitySprite|Black sheep}} Black
*** Uncommon: {{EntitySprite|Gray sheep}}{{EntitySprite|Light gray sheep}}{{EntitySprite|White sheep}}{{EntitySprite|Brown sheep}} Gray, Light Gray, White, and Brown
*** Rare: {{EntitySprite|Pink sheep}} Pink
** Warm biomes:<ref group="info" name="warm biomes"/>
*** Common: {{EntitySprite|Brown sheep}} Brown
*** Uncommon: {{EntitySprite|Gray sheep}}{{EntitySprite|Light gray sheep}}{{EntitySprite|White sheep}}{{EntitySprite|Black sheep}} Gray, Light Gray, White, and Black
*** Rare: {{EntitySprite|Pink sheep}} Pink
* [[Sheep]] colors for temperate biomes is unchanged from current behavior.
* In a parity update with {{BE}}, sheep {{in|je}} now display the correct wool color on their undercoat, and eat [[ferns]].
* Now eat dry grass.

[[File:25w07a and 1.21.70.23 - wandering trader trades.jpg|thumb]]
'''[[File:Wandering Trader.png|32px]] [[Wandering trader]]'''
* Improved prices, more trade options, and larger stock amounts for many items.
* New items the wandering trader can sell:
** {{BlockLink|Logs}} (Oak, Spruce, Birch, Jungle, Acacia, Dark Oak, Cherry, Pale Oak)
** {{ItemLink|Iron Pickaxe|Enchanted Iron Pickaxe}}
** {{ItemLink|Potion of Invisibility}}
* The wandering trader now offers to buy two items from the following list:
** {{ItemLink|Water Bottle}}
** {{ItemLink|Water Bucket}}
** {{ItemLink|Milk Bucket}}
** {{ItemLink|Fermented Spider Eye}}
** {{ItemLink|Baked Potato}}
** {{BlockLink|Hay Bale}}

'''[[File:Wolf JE2 BE2.png|32px]] [[Wolf]]'''
* Now has sound personalities: Big, classic, cute, puglin, angry, grumpy, and sad.
* Wolves receive their sound personalities when they spawn.
* These change how wolves sound when they bark, pant, whine, or growl.
